object.name: ServiceNowGovernance - Dev
object.description: This is used for provisioning user accounts in ServiceNow.

attributes.name: sys_id
attributes.description: Unique ID generated by system for the user

attributes.name: groups
attributes.description: List of groups the user belongs to

attributes.name: sys_created_on
attributes.description: The date this user was created in ServiceNow

attributes.name: sys_created_by
attributes.description: Administrator who created the user in ServiceNow

attributes.name: active
attributes.description: Indicates if the user account has been staged for use

attributes.name: locked_out
attributes.description: Indicates if the user account is locked

attributes.name: source
attributes.description: Identifies whether LDAP is used to validate a user. If the Source field starts with 'ldap', then the user is validated via LDAP. If the Source field does not start with 'ldap', then the password on the user record is used to validate the user when they log in.

attributes.name: vip
attributes.description: Indicates if the user is a VIP

attributes.name: zip
attributes.description: The user's ZIP or postal code

attributes.name: u_azure_object_id
attributes.description: Azure reference ID. This may not be needed after we separate the SNOW user creation from Azure account creation, but if needed we can still supply it once we also have onboarded Azure to SailPoint.

attributes.name: u_employee_type
attributes.description: User or Employee type in SerivceNow. should match to Identity userType for staff type identities.

attributes.name: sys_id
attributes.description: Unique ID generated by system for the user group

attributes.name: active
attributes.description: Indicates if the user group has been staged for use

attributes.name: exclude_manager
attributes.description: Indicates if the user group has been staged for use

attributes.name: sys_created_on
attributes.description: The date the user group was created in ServiceNow

attributes.name: sys_created_by
attributes.description: Administrator who created the user group in ServiceNow

attributes.name: sys_updated_on
attributes.description: Timestamp for the user group's most recent update

attributes.name: sys_updated_by
attributes.description: The user that made the most recent update to the user group

attributes.name: sys_mod_count
attributes.description: A tally of the number of updates made to the user group

attributes.name: roles
attributes.description: List of roles associated with the user group

attributes.name: sys_id
attributes.description: Unique ID generated by system for the role

attributes.name: sys_replace_on_upgrade
attributes.description: Indicates if the system should replace the default version during the next upgrade

attributes.name: sys_updated_on
attributes.description: Timestamp for the most recent update to the role

attributes.name: grantable
attributes.description: Indicates if the role can be granted independently

attributes.name: sys_created_on
attributes.description: Date and time the role was created in ServiceNow

attributes.name: sys_created_by
attributes.description: The user that created the role

attributes.name: can_delegate
attributes.description: Indicates if the role can be delegated

attributes.name: sys_policy
attributes.description: Defines how application files are protected when they're downloaded or installed

attributes.name: sys_updated_by
attributes.description: The user that last updated the role

attributes.name: sys_tags
attributes.description: The role's tags in the system

attributes.name: sys_package
attributes.description: The name of the application the role is associated with

attributes.name: elevated_privilege
attributes.description: Indicates if the role is an elevated privilege

attributes.name: sys_mod_count
attributes.description: A tally of the number of updates made to the role

attributes.name: sys_customer_update
attributes.description: Indicates if the role was added or modified by a customer

attributes.name: sys_scope
attributes.description: The role's scope within the application

attributes.name: includes_roles
attributes.description: Indicates if the role contains other roles

attributes.name: roles
attributes.description: List of roles contained within the role
